intro: Stiza pungens, commonly known as the pungent stiza, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related species. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, violet-colored flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
